Hi all, I started receiving this message when I'm trying to run my Vue application for local environment:
```HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin] line 0: Coded files must be smaller than 1.5 MiB```
It is caused by main.js file. It's ok for production environments where js files should be as small as possible but this this is my local development env. For this env files could be large because we need to ship with them uncompressed code to be able to debug it. Is there any way to increase this threshold? This problem stopped development in my project...
are your sourcemaps inline?

So really the options I can think of:
1. In your hubl add a condition to load your bundle files from a different place. If this is your local development workflow with a hosted portal you could in the interim simply set your script src to <http://localhost>..xxxx, OR use a different host.
2. Split sourcemap out to different file.

Thank you for advices! I didn't include source maps in my build yet. But I added them and now my bundle has 2.8MB :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye: So this is not a solution,

Adding a condition to hubl is a solution but it makes setting up development env much harder because you need to set up a server which will be hosting main.js file. Do you know any npm package that would help with hosting?
I'll try `local-web-server` .
i'm assuming this is all client-side javascript?
Yes
So you can host this on a free host - eg: netlify or S3 (will likely cost $0)
if it's just for you and not showing anyone then you can just use the local development server and set the script src to <http://localhost/dist/bundle.js>
you may even be able to use HubSpot File storage (rather than the coded files storage)

Yes. I'd like to set up environment for single developer so I'll go with local web server. Now I have a problem with module.html file which imports .js file. I can't change there anything because on every build this file is overridden. Can I stop `HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin` from overriding this file?

Just trying to figure out my workflow here.

Hi i started getting following upload validation error today
Error in `@HubSpot/simple_menu.module/module.html`: NullPointerException
Anyone else experiencing the same or know how to fix?

Did you auth the portal first?

The config needs to have the credentials for each account you want to connect to. PROD would be whatever name you gave the account in the auth process
Iâ€™ve been getting this today too.
Definitely seems to be tied to the simple_menu.module. I can comment those out and upload without error.
Thank you Jon I completely forgot about adding my new account to the config file. "Config" in the error should have alerted me to it :face_with_rolling_eyes:.
Hey <@U02DD64P88Z> can you retry this and see if you are still receiving this error?

Hi there, not sure if this is the right channel so lmk if I should switch, but I'm trying to implement the HubSpot live chat into a react app. I've looked <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Chat-integration-issue-with-React/m-p/275219|here> and <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Embed-Chat-Into-A-ReactJS-SPA/td-p/275754|here> but neither has a good solution. I've added the script tag to my index.html file but nothing loads. Is there a better solution for SPA's that want to integrate with HubSpot's live chat?
it depends what you're expecting to do. You should be able to embed it like any other library (likely best inside useEffect)
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/conversations_api/hsconversationssettings>
you'll probabaly want to set loadImmediately to false
thanks for the quick response. I want to have the chat dialog at the bottom right of the page across the whole application
so add the script to the document through a useEffect hook when app.jsx loads maybe?
where do I put the window.hsConversationSettings and HubSpotConversations.widget.load()
I seem to be still getting the error
Yeah just run `hs auth` and it will walk you through connecting the additional account.

<@U2H3TT8F2> i seem to have fixed it in my environment, i had simple menus in both my footer/header partials so i had to go to design tools to comment out references to simple menus in both header/footer and publish changes. Then i was able to upload my other page templates through the CLI watch. I uncommented out the references to simple menu and it's back to working fine
Oh nice, i know we also just pushed another fix to this so it might be related to that as well. Ill verify on my end the fix was pushed :slightly_smiling_face:
